@Epsilon_Grumpy @Rahul__Uppal Side effect with any high growth product unfortunately. Until a brand steps up and flips the meta like Fnatic itâ€™s challenging.
@Epsilon_Grumpy @Rahul__Uppal The Warriors for instance, will be one of the best front offices in the industry. The Cavs, donâ€™t get me started...
@Epsilon_Grumpy @Rahul__Uppal Personally think Riot are striking a nice balance between established endemics and non endemics.
@Epsilon_Grumpy @Rahul__Uppal What I find laughable is people getting all entitled about teams not being accepted when they often barely have an infrastructure for it.

Thatâ€™s not to say it canâ€™t be done. OWL would do well to look at ELEAGUES CSGO VTs for inspiration.
RL excels in its simplicity. LoL has a fanbase. OW? Iâ€™m not yet convinced. Amazing fun to play, so difficult to explain to a new viewer.
99.9% of viewership is online. That is why itâ€™s so crucial to deliver a simple viewing product.
Outside of tent pole events, thereâ€™s no evidence you could fill a significantly sized arena each week.
League and OWL may be in the same city, but no numbers so far suggest theyâ€™d be competing for viewership. Different demos and fan makeup.
Given OWL is highly unlikely to be pulling thousands of LAN spectators (capacity is well below that), I donâ€™t buy the LA piece with IMT.
